questiontext.text:
Vase I contains nine red balls and one white ball. Vase II contains six red and four white balls. We repeat 20 times in a row the following experiment:

  1. First, throw a pure die. 2. If the number of eyes is divisible by three, randomly choose a ball from vase I. Otherwise, randomly pick a ball from vase II.

After each repetition, the selected ball is returned to the vase from which it was taken. from which it was taken.Ê  Which of the following statements is correct?

answer.text: The number of red balls chosen is binomially distributed with n=20 and p=0.90.

feedback.text: The number of red balls chosen is binomially distributed with n=20 and p=0.90…: Incorrect

answer.text: The number of red balls chosen is binomially distributed with n=20 and p=0.60.

feedback.text: The number of red balls chosen is binomially distributed with n=20 and p=0.60…: Incorrect

answer.text: The number of red balls chosen is binomially distributed with n=20 and p=0.75.

feedback.text: The number of red balls chosen is binomially distributed with n=20 and p=0.75: Incorrect

answer.text: The number of red balls chosen is binomially distributed with n=20 and p=0.70.

feedback.text: The number of red balls chosen is binomially distributed with n=20 and p=0.70: Correct

answer.text: The probability distribution of the number of red balls chosen is not a binomial distribution at all.

feedback.text: The probability distribution of the number of red balls chosen is not a binomial distribution at all…: Incorrect
